info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 1:24AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A large cluster of showers with torrential rainfall and a few embedded thunderstorms will impact portions of northeast Connecticut and into parts of central and eastern Massachusetts through 245 AM EDT... At 121 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a large cluster of showers with torrential rainfall and a few embedded thunderstorms extending from northeast Connecticut and into parts of central and eastern Massachusetts, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Boston, Worcester, Cambridge, Quincy, Lynn, Newton, Somerville, Framingham, Waltham, Malden, Brookline, Medford, Weymouth, Revere, Peabody, Arlington, Everett, Salem, Woonsocket and Billerica. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.
